turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Endobronchial valve.
turn.1: What is the function of the Endobronchial valve?
turn.2: Endobronchial valve An endobronchial valve (EBV), is an implantable medical device—a small, one-way valve, which is implanted in an airway in the pulmonary system to treat one of several lung conditions.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Endobronchial valves are typically implanted using a flexible delivery catheter advanced through a bronchoscope, and thus they are minimally invasive.
turn.5: Is there any other functions of the endobronchial valve?
turn.6: The valves are also removable if they are not working properly.
turn.7: Can you tell me more about the one-way valve?
turn.8: The one-way endobronchial valve is typically implanted such that when a patient exhales, air is able to flow through the valve and out of the lung compartment that is fed by that airway, but when the patient inhales, the valve closes and blocks air from entering that lung compartment.
turn.9: What else does the one-way valve do?
turn.10: Thus, an implanted endobronchial valve typically helps a lung compartment to empty itself of air.
turn.11: Is there any more information on the function of the endobronchial valve?
turn.12: This has been shown to be beneficial in the treatment of emphysema, where lungs lose their elasticity and thus cannot contract sufficiently to exhale air, leading to air trapping and hyperinflation.
